attacks.name: Data Sort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card from your discard pile, show it to your opponent, and then shuffle it into your deck.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

data.name: Krookodile

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Bombast
attacks.text: Does 40 damage times the number of Prize cards you have taken.

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

data.name: Scorched Earth
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Fire or Fighting Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does so, he or she draws 2 cards.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Galarian Stunfisk

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.

data.name: Espeon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Miraculous Shine
attacks.text: Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker

abilities.name: Steely Spirit
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

data.name: Minccino

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Super Potion
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Meloetta

attacks.name: Tag Cheer
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shooting Star Pirouette
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

data.name: Professor Kukui
rules: Draw 2 cards. During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Beast Ball
rules: Look at your face-down Prize cards. You may reveal an Ultra Beast card you find there, put it into your hand, and put this Beast Ball in its place. (If you don't reveal an Ultra Beast card, put this card in the discard pile.) Then, shuffle your face-down Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardenia
rules: Heal 80 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.name: Rocky Helmet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damage by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Black Market ◇
rules: When a Darkness Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) that has any Darkness Energy attached to it is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card.
Whenever any player plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Stadium card.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

data.name: Bronzor
data.flavorText: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn't come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.

data.name: Starly

attacks.name: Call for Pals
attacks.text: Search your deck for as many Starly as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon or Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Po Town
rules: Whenever any player plays a Pokémon from their hand to evolve 1 of their Pokémon, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Although it's powerful enough to dig right through volcanic rock, it doesn't allow itself to be seen very often.

data.name: Cynthia's Feelings
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 4 more cards.

data.name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

data.name: Altaria-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Powerful Gain
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Wind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Lucario LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Lucario. Lucario LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Stance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Lucario LV.X from your hand onto your Active Lucario, you may use this power. Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Lucario during your opponent's next turn. (If Lucario is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lucario by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Hypnotoxic Laser
rules: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is also Asleep.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hala
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. If you have used your GX attack, draw 7 cards. If not, draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Unidentified Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.
This card can't retreat.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour!

data.name: Alolan Ninetales

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Possessing a calm demeanor, this Pokémon was revered as a deity incarnate before it was identified as a regional variant of Ninetales.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shrine of Memories
rules: Each player's evolved Pokémon can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (That player still needs the necessary Energy to use each attack.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Energy Pickup
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Beast Energy ◇
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

While this card is attached to an Ultra Beast, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

data.name: Kartana-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Slice Off
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gale Blade
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Blade-GX
attacks.text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mallow
rules: Search your deck for 2 cards, shuffle your deck, and put those cards on top of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kyogre

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Grand Wave
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Grand Wave during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Rocket's Handiwork
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent's deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60.

data.flavorText: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.

data.name: Skyla
rules: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shroomish

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

data.name: Mawile

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

data.name: Venusaur-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jungle Hammer
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Team Flare Grunt
rules: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Staravia

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

data.name: Darkrai-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Head
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Rhyhorn.

data.name: Bronzong

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.

data.name: Rotom Dex Poké Finder Mode
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put them back in any order or shuffle them into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Zygarde

abilities.name: Cellular Companions
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Zygarde's and Zygarde-GX's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boost Fang
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This is Zygarde when about 10% of its pieces have been assembled. It leaps at its opponent's chest and sinks its sharp fangs into them.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio

abilities.name: Hair Wall
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.

data.name: Magmortar LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Magmortar. Magmortar LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Torrid Wave
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Magmortar is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 2 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Magmortar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Bluster
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Magmortar can't use Flame Bluster.

data.name: Aegislash V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.

data.name: Bill's Maintenance
rules: Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alolan Muk

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.

data.name: Plasma Frigate
rules: Each Pokémon that has any Plasma Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Rayquaza

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokémon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.

data.name: Cinccino

abilities.name: Smooth Coat
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.

data.name: Poké Radar
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose as many Pokémon as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Silent Lab
rules: Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Unit Energy FightingDarknessFairy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Fighting, Darkness, and Fairy Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Repel
rules: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Manectric

abilities.name: Electric Start
abilities.text: If you go second, and if this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down as your Active Pokémon or on your Bench.

attacks.name: Double Charge
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Cyclone Slash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn't very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

rules: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Claw Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.
